properties.description: Provinces table stores province/city level information. Use this to find province names, city-level data, or when the user asks about Hà Nội city information. Contains id (example: 12) and name (example: Hà Nội).
Unique identifier for each province, e.g. '12' for Hà Nội
Official name of the province or city

Districts table stores all urban districts (quận/huyện) in Hà Nội. Use this to find district names, look up a specific area, or translate between district name and its IDs. Contains id (internal ID, example: ID_00000), name (example: Quận Ba Đình, Huyện Sóc Sơn), normalized_name (ASCII-safe version, example: Quan Ba Dinh), administrative_id (VNM format, example: VNM.27.1_1), province_id referencing provinces.
Internal district identifier used in Forecast API (ID_XXXXX format)
Foreign key referencing provinces.id, linking the district to its parent province
Official Vietnamese name of the district
ASCII-normalized (diacritic-stripped) version of the district name for search and matching
Administrative ID in VNM.27.X_1 format used in Rankings API
Timestamp when this district record was first inserted

Air component table defines the types of air quality measurements tracked in the system. Use this to understand what each component_id means, look up component descriptions, or list all tracked pollutants. Contains name (example: aqi, pm25, pm10, o3, no2, so2, co) and human-readable descriptions.
Auto-incremented unique identifier for each air component record
Short code name of the air quality component used as component_id in distric_stats
Human-readable description of the air component
Timestamp when this air component record was inserted

District stats table is the main fact table storing hourly AQI and PM2.5 measurements per district per day. Use this for all air quality queries: current AQI, historical trends, comparing districts, finding the most/least polluted area, ranking districts by air quality, daily or hourly breakdown. Contains date, hour (0–23), component_id (example: aqi, pm25), aqi_value (example: 45, 120, 180), pm25_value, and district_id. AQI levels: 0–50 Tốt (Good), 51–100 Trung bình (Moderate), 101–150 Kém (Unhealthy for sensitive), 151–200 Xấu (Unhealthy), 201–300 Rất xấu (Very unhealthy), 301+ Nguy hại (Hazardous).
Auto-incremented unique identifier for each measurement record
The calendar date of the measurement
Hour of the day (0–23) when the measurement was recorded; NULL means daily aggregate
The type of air quality component measured, matching air_component.name
Measured Air Quality Index value. AQI scale: 0–50 Good, 51–100 Moderate, 101–150 Unhealthy for sensitive groups, 151–200 Unhealthy, 201–300 Very Unhealthy, 301+ Hazardous
Measured PM2.5 fine particulate matter concentration in µg/m³
Foreign key referencing districts.id (ID_XXXXX format), identifying which district the measurement belongs to
Timestamp when this measurement record was inserted into the database
